description: An mplsLspUp trap signifies that the
specified LSP is up. The current active
path for the LSP is mplsLspPathName.

Summary.eval: ($v2=='') ? 'MPLS LSP Up ( LSP: $v1 )' : 'MPLS LSP Up ( LSP: $v1, Active Path: $v2 )'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::snMplsLspUp FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName.22.11 s EXAMPLE FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if
any. If there is none, the name should be
empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName

description: An mplsLspDown trap signifies that the
specified LSP is down, because the current
active path mplsLspPathName went down.

Summary.eval: ($v2=='') ? 'MPLS LSP Down ( LSP: $v1 )' : 'MPLS LSP Down ( LSP: $v1, Active Path: $v2 )'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::snMplsLspDown FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName.22.11 s EXAMPLE FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if
any. If there is none, the name should be
empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName

description: An mplsLspChange trap signifies that the
the specified LSP has switched traffic to
the new active path 'toLspPath'. The LSP maintains
up state before and after the switch over

Summary.eval: ($v2=='') ? 'MPLS LSP Switched to New Active Path ( LSP: $v1 )' : 'MPLS LSP Switched to New Active Path ( LSP: $v1, Active Path: $v2 )'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::snMplsLspChange FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName.22.11 s EXAMPLE FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspName

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if
any. If there is none, the name should be
empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: FOUNDRY-MPLS-MIB::mplsLspPathName
